Posts.Content: You are right. You made me cry, but good tears. The picture says it all. I'm going to print it and put it on my fridge to remind me. Thank You Hugs, Suse xxx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer Nov 14'. Lumpectomy no spread in lymph...

Posts.Content: Thank You makes me feel much better hearing stories like this Love Suse x
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer Nov 14'. Lumpectomy no spread in lymph...

Posts.Content: Due my last chemo in a week then radio. Why wont they give me a scan to ease my anxiety. I've asked oncologist. She said there is no need! I'm having so many aches and pains. They said its due to the chemo/the menopause. My bloods are ok they said. Struggled with chemo but light at the end of the tunnel now with one more. I feel I need to move on but can't. Is it a risk on your health with scans?
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer Nov 14'. Lumpectomy no spread in lymph...

Posts.Content: Hi Genny thank you for replying to me. Wish I was a stronger person! Its nice to speak with someone who's already been through this . Mine was 3cms and aggressive. I just cant get on track atm. My children have said they just want me" back to normal". I feel so irritable and question everything. I know you're right when you say trust the experts, but feel a bit out on a limb. Are you back in work? If not when are you thinking of returning? I need to go back but am putting it off in case I can't  cope. Lots of hugs Suse xxx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer Nov 14'. Lumpectomy no spread in lymph...

Posts.Content: Hi Denise thank you for replying. Can't believe how overwhelmed I feel sometimes. It's nice to think i'm not on my own. Funnily enough my husband said the same thing. He said I'd find something else to worry about. I did join a course but everyone was terminal so I was really depressed when I came home. I already do a mindfulness course which is good but with chemo I haven't been able to attend as much. Just wish I was back to normal, feel like i've had a rug pulled from under me. Thank you love Suse xxx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer Nov 14'. Lumpectomy no spread in lymph...

Posts.Content: You're right! I said same thing about mastectomy and my surgeon said no. I feel like a right misery atm, not good company! Need to dig myself out of this hole. Hugs Suse xxx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer Nov 14'. Lumpectomy no spread in lymph...

Posts.Content: Thank you G n' J you are so supportive, and a wealth of information. This anxiety is driving me mad, need to get back on track but finding it hard.  I've been looking for survivors stories but no one seems to write after years being diagnosed. I think my tumour was a grade 3 stage 2a and to do with hormones. Most of my friends have had two different types of chemo. They've kept me on FEC all the way through but don't know why.  I feel I spend so much time asking questions when I have my oncology apt that they're fed up with me.. My BC nurse hasn't even been in touch. Got so many fears . re going back to work........When?,  should I go on a holiday abroad or stay in this country. Argh I think everything's overwhelming me again!!! Just want to run away! . Thanks both  xxx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer Nov 14'. Lumpectomy no spread in lymph...

Posts.Content: Fantastic story. x
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer Nov 14'. Lumpectomy no spread in lymph...

Posts.Content: Thanks for replying. I had to come off Tamoxifen because it made my uterus  lining thicken which they told me could turn to cancer and the biopsy was so painful also a camera was painful and they said I would have to have that more regular if I bled again which totally put me off.  After reading some of these posts I realised I'm on the worst brand of letrozole so that has made me feel better, I am going to phone my GP tomorrow to get this sorted and hopefully I will be ok , good luck with your appointmentx
Posts.Title: Letrezol

Posts.Content: Thank you x
Posts.Title: Letrezol

Posts.Content: Thank you x
Posts.Title: Letrezol

Posts.Content: Thank you x
Posts.Title: Letrezol

Posts.Content: Hi all. Haven't been on here for a while. I've been taking tamoxifen for 4 years and have been fine on wokhardt make,but after a build up in my womb and painful biopsies they have told me I have to go on letrozole which is causing havoc in my life.... the joint pains in my legs are horrendous I wondered if anyone has any suggestions on brands as with tamoxifen I had to try 5 brands before I was suitable for the one I was on . I have left the letrezole off for a week now and my pains have gone but know I have to go back on them. My Cancer Centre said to try them for 6 months I am 56 years old and feel like a 95 year old especially in the mornings please can anyone advise what brand is best, thank you in advance . I feel like coming off them altogether. X

Posts.Title: Letrezol

Posts.Content: I've had so many different answers and my hairs white, not sure what to do. Any suggestions please, I would be really grateful. Thank you in advance.
Posts.Title: When can I colour my hair after chemo and do I need to use a vegetable...

Posts.Content: Thank You. So may different ones out there. Good Luck. xxx
Posts.Title: What is the best cream to use before I start radiotherapy

Posts.Content: So many different creams for radiotherapy. Please advise?
Posts.Title: What is the best cream to use before I start radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Thank You . Good Luck too x
Posts.Title: What is the best cream to use before I start radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Take your steroids early in the morning and last ones at lunch time not later than 12 in morning and your sleep pattern should improve. Any later and they keep you awake.
Posts.Title: Chemo Survival Kit – Version 3 – 8 April 2015 - please read and contribute...

Posts.Content: It takes a few days to get out of your system. On my first chemo I had 4hours sleep in 4days. I was completely exhausted. The next chemo they cut the steroids  down to 2 a day . I made sure my last one was taken around 11-12 am that helped a lot. I'm on my third  chemo but I'm now on amitriptyline for relaxation. I'm sleeping much better. Hope this helps . Good Luck!
Posts.Title: Chemo Survival Kit – Version 3 – 8 April 2015 - please read and contribute...

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your helpful replies . I'm so grateful. Love Suse xxx
Posts.Title: re mri

Posts.Content: I too am having chemo for breast cancer. My Dad died two years ago and I took on his dog Gyp, the best move I ever made. He has been a Godsend to me. Since being diagnosed he hasn't left  my side he  knows something is up. When I'm up 3 in the morning he's with me. If I want to cry, he sits with  his head on my lap looking at me. I feel like my Dad is looking down on me. I bought hibiscrub off Amazon and always make sure I scrub my hands. Get your dog it will be the best move you ever made and will take your mind off things. xx
Posts.Title: Silly Question??
